subject: TAKING COMFORT IN HIS LEAD
verse: They, (the false teachers) have lost connection with the head, from whom the whole body, is supported and held together by its ligaments and sinews, grows as God causes it to grow. (Colossians 2:19) (NIV)
reflection:
We are all familiar with the image of the Christian community as the “body of Christ.” Yet sometimes it’s easy for some to forget that their actions affect the rest of the body. I have been sobered by the
realization of how the choices I make, can impact beyond myself. That is when I take comfort in remembering that “Christ is the head.” Together, as we follow His lead, we can form a body that looks upward in worship that moves outward in service.
Ask Jesus for ways to work well with other parts of His body today.
prayer: Gracious God, help us to remember that our actions as members of Christ's body impact the whole, and guide us to follow Christ's lead in unity. May we work together in harmony, looking upward in worship and reaching outward in service to others. (AI)

subject: A HOPEFUL FUTURE
verse: I no longer live, but Christ lives in me. (Galatians 2:20)
reflection:
Because our sins died with Jesus, we are no longer condemned (Colossians 2:13-15). In reality we have become one with Christ, and His experiences are ours. Our Christ-ian life began when, in unity with Him
we died to our old life (see Romans 6:5-11). In our daily life we must crucify sinful desires that keep us from following Christ. This, too, is a kind of dying with Him (Luke 9:23-25). And yet the focus of Christ-ianity is not dying but living. But because we have been crucified with Christ, we have also been raised with Him (Romans 6:5). We are no longer alone, for Christ lives in us—He is our power for living, And our hope for the future. (Colossians 1:27)
prayer: Merciful God, thank You for freeing us from condemnation through Christ's sacrifice and for raising us to new life in Him. Help us daily crucify our sinful desires and live in the power of Christ who dwells within us. (AI)

subject: ONE PASTOR'S CONFESSION
verse: Remember, no one who wants to do wrong should ever say, “God is tempting me.” God is never tempted to do wrong, and He never tempts anyone else either. (14) Temptation comes from the lure of our own desires. (James 1:13-14)
reflection:
This is why I have to confess that I have a problem with the Lord’s Prayer! I can no longer pray “lead us not into temptation.” I now pray, “Do not allow us be led into temptation by Satin.” I do believe a lot of people who live for God often wonder why they still have temptations. David asks that God approve his words and thoughts as though they were offerings brought to the alter.
As you begin each day, pray that God’s love will guide what you say and what you think. Father, let the words of my mouth (or even an email) be used to encourage others.
prayer: Gracious God, may Your love guide our words and thoughts each day, shaping them into offerings that encourage and uplift others. Help us to live with the awareness that our every expression is known to You, and let this knowledge inspire us to speak and think in ways that honor Your name. (AI)

*Today’s Verse:*

*May these words of my mouth and the meditation of my **heart be pleasing
in your sight, Lord, my Rock and my *

*Redeemer. *(Ps. 19:14) NIV


*Today’s Reflection:*

Would you change the way you live *if* you knew that every word and thought
would be examined by God first? David asks that God approve his words and
thoughts

as though they were offerings brought to the alter. As you begin each day,
pray that God’s love will guide what you say and what you think.

*Father, let the words of my mouth (or even an email) **be used to
encourage others.*

* Pastor Sather *
